standard_metadata.standard_description: Find whole-number quotients and remainders with up to four-digit dividends and one-digit divisors, using strategies based on place value, the properties of operations, and/or the relationship between multiplication and division. Illustrate and explain the calculation by using equations, rectangular arrays, and/or area models.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Divide by 1-digit numbers with area models

question.content: Lio split up the area of a rectangle to help him solve the equation $3{,}922 \div 3=?$.  He splits the rectangle into parts that are easy to divide by $3$ and a remainder.    **Complete the equations.**   || -:| :- |:- $a=$ | $1{,}000$ units| $b=$ |  units| $c=$ |  $7$ units| $h =$ |  $a+b+c=$ |  units $3{,}922 \div 3 =$ || remainder

images.alt: Area model split into 4 parts, each with a width of 3 units. From top to bottom the parts have a height of A units and an area of 3,000 square units; a height of B units and an area of 900 square units; a height of C units and an area of 21 square units; an unlabeled height and an area of 1 square unit. A brace labeled H spans the top 3 parts.
same model emphasizing top part with a width of 3 units, a height of A, and an area of 3,000 square units
same model emphasizing part second from the top with a width of 3 units, a height of B, and an area of 900 square units
same model emphasizing part third from the top with a width of 3 units, a height of C, and an area of 21 square units

hints.content: The last $\goldE{1}$ square unit is a remainder, because $1$ is less than $3$.

images.alt: same model emphasizing bottom part with a width of 3 units, an unlabeled height, and an area of 1 square unit
same area model with height spanning the top 3 parts labeled H equals A plus B plus C

hints.content: Now we know $h$ and the remainder. So we also know the answer to $3{,}922 \div 3$.

same model emphasizing top part with a width of 4 units, a height of B, and an area of 36 square units

hints.content: The last $\greenE{3}$ square units are a remainder, because $3$ is less than $4$.

hints.content: Now we know $h$ and the remainder. So we also know the answer to $2{,}439 \div 4$.
